oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The man who is cleansing himself (performing a purification ritual, or |koa) puts some |u' ||ke (from the |u' ||ke' plant) into the |kui food he has cooked on the fire. He scrapes a little into the food. After eating it he lies down. The |u' ||ke' plant intoxicates people. 1) See also The |u' ||ke' or Tshaka, 2) 9920v: !nanni heard this from his paternal grandfather (Karu), 2) This story is found in Book XI & XII-11.
